intro: Buchenavia viridiflora, commonly known as the green-flowered buchenavia, is a shrub native to the tropical regions of South America. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family, which includes many flowering plants. The plant is characterized by its small, elliptical leaves that are typically glossy and dark green. Its flowers are greenish-yellow, with four petals, and are clustered in small inflorescences. Buchenavia viridiflora is often found in moist, shaded environments such as rainforests and along stream banks.
